alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 21 at 5:11AM MST until February 21 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FROM 7 AM TO 8 PM MST TODAY FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS WITH WARM...DRY AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... .Stronger downslope winds will impact the eastern plains today, aided by a deepening lee side trough. Although humidity is not forecast to reach critical threshold, a warm, dry and unstable atmosphere is forecast and after the past few days of drying downslope winds, fine fuels should be supportive of carrying fire. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (zone 104) and the East Central Plains (zone 126) from Tuesday morning into Tuesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to southwest 25 to 35 mph with occasional gusts to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...18 to 25 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
